result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • John James Knepper was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to pay fine and costs within 60 days. If not paid, one day in jail for each $50.00 of unpaid fines.

Defendant is to report on or before August 15,2022 at 4 PM.

Defendant may serve in Jackson County Jail or another county if arrangements can be made with no additional costs to Trempealeau County. 

Defendant is eligible for Huber if employed full time.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Any vehicles titled in the Defendant's name and/or any vehicles operated by the Defendant are subject to an ignition interlock device.  The ignition interlock requirement becomes effective when the Defendant applies for a license.
Defendant is to complete an alcohol assessment and comply with driver's safety plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John James Knepper

records.addlTxt: 1:36 PM DA Sacia appears in person for the state. Defendant appears by video. Attorney Schroeder appears by video. Court advised of conflict. State advised of conflict. Defense advised was aware of both conflicts and okay with proceeding. Defendant can hear/see okay, okay appearing by video, received no threats/promises to appear by video. Court finds def KVI waives personal appearance. Joint recommendation presented to the court. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant KVI waives all rights and enters G plea to count 1. Court finds defendant G of count 1. Defendant sentenced. Count 2 is dismissed under operation of law.
